data.title: FFmpeg as audio and video demuxer and decoder
data.body:
FFmpeg (http://ffmpeg.org/about.html) can decode almost every audio and video format and codec using one API. It is very portable. It can replace Theora, OGG, Vorbis, Opus and other libraries (Speex decoder in FFmpeg uses libspeex). It has also its own audio resampler (with audio channel expansion) and video scaler (with pixel format conversion). It has also various audio and video filters which can be used.

FFmpeg is optimized for performance, e.g. libvorbis is slower than built-in FFmpeg Vorbis decoder:
`ffmpeg -i Test.ogg -acodec pcm_s16le -f wav - &> /dev/null` - 0.51 sec
`oggdec -o - Test.ogg &> /dev/null` - 0.87 sec

FFmpeg can be linked statically or dynamically. Its configuration tool allows to enable only needed formats and codecs.

FFmpeg has also its own protocol support (http, https, file, rtsp, rtmp, ftp, etc...). They can be compiled-in and used (also in other Godot parts), or they might be disabled during compilation. Then custom IO reader can be created which will use Gotots' file and network functions.

It also can decode still images like JPEG/PNG/GIF, but I've never used FFmpeg for still images :)

See also: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5133#issuecomment-226150808

data.title: Windows: Support gamepad vibration using XInput.
data.body: Related to #5013

data.title: Fix Theora video playback without a Vorbis stream
data.body:
- prevent audio resampler errors when number of channels is 0,
- don't check for `audio_done` when there is no audio data.

Fixes #5133 and #4878
Please test :)

data.title: Fix Android export
data.body:
`_should_compress_asset()` now takes the header data from the buffer instead of trying to re-read the actual files, which is why it failed for temp files (atlas, etc.).

Fixes #5208.

data.title: StreamPlayer finished() signal triggers on play()
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Ubuntu 16.04 64-bit. Godot 2.0.3 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected): Using a StreamPlayer to play a .ogg file. Linked the finished() trigger to a script function but the finished() trigger is sent when the stream is started as well as when it's finished.

**Steps to reproduce:** Add StreamPlayer to project, link finished() signal to function, print something in that function and see that it triggers as soon as the StreamPlayer plays as well as whenever it finishes.

data.title: Editing node groups in inspector
data.body:
Right now the only way to add a node to a group is by script.
It could be great if groups could be edited in inspector.

Thanks.

data.title: Enable zoom with mousewheel in the visual shader editor
data.body:
When dealing with anything beyond a basic shader graph, it becomes very important to zoom in and out regularly, as things tend to get quite big.

Being able to do it with the mousewheel is way faster than having to click those zoom buttons on the left corner.

I found that relevant code for this was already done but commented out with a note "hard to get it right". I enabled it back and tried it out and found out its working as expected.

Would it be ok to get this back or is there any problem I've not been able to see?

data.title: Add ODBC support
data.body:
Greetings,

In many context, specially those with a lot of information to store such as user information, progress, logins & scoreboards, databases are fundamental to those applications/games.

Unfortunately, there's no support for larger scaled databases in Godot and the current format is extremely limited.

This is why I suggest the implementation of ODBC with, as suggestion, [nanodbc](http://lexicalunit.github.io/nanodbc/). 
It is MIT licensed, light and cross-platform.

Why do I suggested ODBC over any other specific method/protocol? 
Simply because it's supported by most of database softwares (e.g.: Microsoft SQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQLite, etc.) with a generic syntax and it's platform independent.

Let me know your thoughts about it.
Thanks! :smile:

data.title: error while exporting to android
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
(1) error while exporting scene or gd script

```
ERROR: EditorExportPlatformAndroid::_should_compress_asset: Condition ' !f ' is true. returned: true
   At: platform\android\export\export.cpp:1053
```

(2) error if convert images to webp.

```
format
ERROR: ResourceImportMetadata::get_option: Condition ' !options.has(p_key) ' is true. returned: Variant()
   At: core\resource.cpp:102
res://textures/bg.jpg MD5: 53be2ea2c94e814ebbfc1b4b87346cdd FLAGS: 98
large
ERROR: ResourceImportMetadata::get_option: Condition ' !options.has(p_key) ' is true. returned: Variant()
   At: core\resource.cpp:102
path: C:\Users\volzh\AppData\Roaming/Godot/tmp/imgexp-53be2ea2c94e814ebbfc1b4b87346cdd.tex flags: 7
SAVING: C:/Users/volzh/AppData/Roaming/Godot/tmp/imgexp-53be2ea2c94e814ebbfc1b4b87346cdd.tex
ERROR: EditorExportPlatformAndroid::_should_compress_asset: Condition ' !f ' is true. returned: true
   At: platform\android\export\export.cpp:1053
res://textures/blocks/artifact_1.png MD5: 0f5fa1ad1799dc516090a7206f94feb1 FLAGS: 98
```

APK file is generated but error occurs as many as number of scenes, gdscripts, images.

**Steps to reproduce:**
for (1) error : just export to android
for (2) error : Export > Project Export Settings > Images > Convert Images > Compress for Disk and export to android

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Polygon2D now honors canvas opacity.
data.body: Previously, multi-colored polygons ignored canvas opacity, and the last patch made every polygon a multi-colored one.

data.title: Adding multi dimension support to HTTPClient.query_string_from_dict()
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Using : Godot_v2.0.3_stable_x11.64 on linuxmint 17.2

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I have a query parameters array like

```
var query = {
    'firm': 1
    , 'type': 2
    , 'duedate' : {
    'start':01-01-1970
    , 'end':14-06-2016
    }
}
```

I expect it to be encoded like

```
?duedate[end]=14-06-2016&duedate[start]=01-01-1970&firm=1&type=2
```

But output is like below

```
?duedate=%28end%3A02-06-2016%29%2C%20%28start%3A01-01-1970%29&firm=1&type=2
```

It seem as if dictionaries are treated as one dimesional structures by HTTPClient so multi dimensional encoding support is needed.

data.title: no clean optimized and fast way to sort StringArray
Expose missing Quaternion operators.
data.body:
Scripts can now evaluate the following cases:
- (quat \* real) and (quat / real)
- (quat + quat) and (quat - quat)

data.title: Implement ShortCuts in CanvasItemEditor
data.body:
I just ended up adding shortcuts for Q, W, E, V and Shift+V. Everything else has mouse events involved and `ShortCut` does not seem to support them right now.

I couldn't add the shortcuts directly to the buttons because it wouldn't check if the key was pressed and if it was not an echo key event... (also it would have been affected by #5174).
